Simply apply the solution directly to the stain and gently work it into the fabric. To help further work in the stain, pour hot water onto the area being treated. Let the solution sit for roughly 30 minutes and use a damp Lint-Free Cleaning Cloth to wipe away the suds and clean the area. Air dry the cover.
Happy Laundering -The Laundress

Content.name: Dear Laundress, I love your Wool and Cashmere Shampoo! You have a truly wonderful website, just loaded with information. My question is: why is washing cashmere by hand necessary? Would a front loading machine, set on 'delicate' be okay?
Content.description:
Dear Barbara, Thank you for the awesome compliment - we are so glad to hear of your great success with The Laundress products. While cashmere may be either machine washed on the delicate/woolens cycle in cold water or handwashed, we recommend handwashing as this is the surest way to prevent any shrinking. The shrinking of cashmere generally occurs when heat or agitation is applied, so if the wash cycle chosen is too harsh shrinking may occur. If the appropriate setting are chosen, however, your cashmere should turn out perfectly! Another precautionary measure to taken when machine washing would be to place the item in a Mesh Bag to prevent any tangling or snagging.
Happy Laundering- The Laundress

Content.name: Dear Laundress, You say that the new storage bags are moth and bug proof, can you explain what is done to make them moth proof? I would love not to have to use moth flakes.
Content.description:
Dear Dolores, We say that the Beckel Canvas prevents bug and moth contamination because their 100% 20 oz. cotton canvas enclosure and heavy duty double zipper with reinforced corners makes it nearly impossible for these critters to chew threw. For additional security, you can place a Lavender Pouch or Cedar Drawer Sheet in the bag when storing as the scent of lavender and cedar is a natural repellent.
Happy Laundering -The Laundress

Content.name: Dear Laundress- I was wondering if your baby detergent and softener is safe to use on bamboo cloth diapers?
Content.description:
Dear Ann,
Formulated with plant-derived anionic and nonionic surfactants, stain-fighting enzymes, and mineral-derived cleaning enhancers, our Baby Detergent is gentle enough for bamboo diapers yet tough on stains. When washing items such as diapers and towels, one should avoid using fabric softeners as they generally tend to reduce absorbency. I hope this information is of help to you. If you have any further questions, please let me know.
Happy Laundering, The Laundress

Content.name: Dear Laundress- I have your entire line and I would like some advice on how to get a mustard stain out of a Tommy Bahama t-shirt that was washed in without being noticed! Any advice would be greatly appreciated as this is a favorite t-shirt.
Content.description:
Dear Laurel,
Assuming that your top is either a cotton, linen or durable synthetic blend (because it was machine washed), I recommend applying Stain Solution and All-Purpose Bleach Alternative directly to the stain and pouring hot water onto the mixture to activate the bleach alternative beads. Gently work this solution into the fabric and follow by soaking in bath of warm water for roughly 30 minutes. If the stain isn't removed at the soak's completion, you may need to repeat this process. Once satisfied with removal, launder as normal.
**Please note that this process should only be used for cottons, linens and durable synthetics. If your shirt contains any amount of silk, wool or leather, the All-Purpose Bleach Alternative should not be used.
Happy Laundering -The Laundress

Content.name: Dear Laundress- What is the shelf life of your products?
Content.description:
Dear Hannah, Thank you for reaching out. Our products have a shelf life of approximately 2 years, bottles opened or sealed. As they are all natural and do not contain artificial dyes, there may be a shift in color prior to reaching the 2 year mark. The change in color does not mean that the product has gone bad or is less effective, but rather a natural occurrence over time.
Happy Laundering! The Laundress

Content.name: Dear Laundress- I Like your Wool and Cashmere Shampoo, is there a soap you recommend for hand-washing dry clean only cotton flannel pants?
Content.description:
Dear Bob, For handwashing Dry Clean Only cotton pants, I recommend using either the Signature Detergent or Delicate Wash. When handwashing, apply 1 capful of either formula into a bath of tepid water and leave to soak for roughly 30 minutes. At the soak's completion, rinse well until all soapy water runs clear and gently press out excess water. Flat the item flat in its natural shape to dry.
Happy Laundering The Laundress

Content.name: Dear Laundress- I have a purse which I love but the inside lining desperately needs to be cleaned. Can you recommend a product and tips on how to clean the lining (seems to be a cotton/synthetic blend)?
Content.description:
Dear Jill, My best recommendation would be to spot treat the lining with the Wash & Stain Bar, by simply wetting the bar and gently working it into the stained areas. To remove soap and dirt, blot the lining with a damp Lint Free Cleaning Cloth. Spot treating can be tricky, however, as your bag is leather and leather has the potential to discolor when wet. That being said, be sure to avoid getting the outer leather wet.
Happy Laundering -The Laundress

Content.name: How can I wash lint off of a sweater?
Content.description:
Dear Sylvia, To best remove lint from clothing during the wash cycle, I recommend laundering with Darks Detergent. The Darks Detergent is formulated with color guard, keeping colors vibrant, while stain-fighting enzymes work to remove micro fibrils (lint), dust, and hair/fur throughout the wash cycle. To remove lint between washes, I suggest brushing with the Clothing & Upholstery Brush.
Happy Laundering The Laundress

Content.name: Dear Laundress How do I wash clothes made of microfiber? Which detergent should I use and is it okay to use the fabric conditioner?
Content.description:
You may wash microfibers with the Signature Detergent, however we advise not to wash with a fabric softener as this will clog the open spaces in the microfiber and damage the integrity of the fabric.
Happy Laundering -The Laundress

Content.name: Dear Laundress- Do you have any suggestions for returning white silk to brightness? I have several handsome silk blouses that used to be white but are now dingy and yellowing.
Content.description:
Thank you for reaching out. For brightening your white silk blouse and reducing yellowing, my best recommendation would be to soak the affected blouse in a bath of cool water and 1/4 cup of white vinegar, such as our Scented Vinegar, and leave to sit for no longer than 30 minutes. If the yellowing has faded but is still visible at the soak's completion, you may need to repeat this soak until satisfied.
Follow by handwashing the blouse in a bath of cool water and Delicate Wash, allowing to soak for no longer than 30 minutes. At the soak's completion, rinse well until all soapy water runs clear and gently press out excess water.
Lay the blouse flat in its natural shape to dry and steam while damp for best results.
Please note that while silk is a washable fabric, it has a maximum shrinking allowance of 5%. When washing silk, it is always best to perform a water test prior to washing. Simply wet a small, inconspicuous area of the garment, such as a seam or hem, and leave to air dry. If the fabric dries back to its initial state, it should be safe to wash.
Happy Laundering! -The Laundress

Content.name: Dear Laundress, I have always been instructed not to mix bleach and vinegar as it produces chlorine gas. I love The Laundress and not only use many products regularly, but also follow the blog and "things we love" religiously, and I was very surprised to see this combination in use.
Content.description:
Because the All-Purpose Bleach Alternative is a chlorine-free oxygen bleach, it will not produce a chlorine gas if mixed with white vinegar, such as our Scented Vinegar. While we taking our cleaning seriously, safety is always top priority!
Happy Laundering! The Laundress

Content.name: Dear Laundress- I have a vintage Fleurette 100% camel hair coat. It says dry clean only, but I'm adverse to all the chemicals used at the dry cleaners. Is there another way to launder it?
Content.description:
Darkly dyed silk lining tends to bleed, so I want to make certain that your coat will not experience such results when washed! You can also perform a water test on the lining to ensure that it is safe to wash.
Water Test: Wet a small, inconspicuous area of the lining and dab with a dry, white Lint-Free Cleaning Cloth. If color is removed onto the cloth, then the lining will bleed onto the exterior and should be dry cleaned. If no color is removed, you can proceed with washing.
Pretreat: Apply Stain Solution directly to any stained or soiled areas and gently work it into the fabric.
Handwash: Handwash in a bath of cool water and Wool & Cashmere Shampoo and leave to soak for no longer than 30 minutes. Rinse well until all soapy water runs clear and gently press out excess water.
Dry: Lay flat in its natural shape to dry and steam while damp for best results.
Happy Laundering! The Laundress

Content.name: Dear Laundress, Is there a specific product to keep cat hair from adhering to clothing?
Content.description:
Thank you for reaching out. My best suggestion would be to wash with the Darks Detergent. This product works to remove micro fibrils (lint), dust and hair/fur throughout the wash cycle and is formulated with color guard, keeping colors vibrant. I also recommend the Pet & Lint Brush for removing pet hair lingering on clothing or furniture. Its unique, rubber "bristles" make it the most effective tool to remove serious lint and pet hair from furniture, blankets and clothing.
Happy Laundering! The Laundress
